body: @probeyang You failed to upload image.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18691244/116061060-03ebab80-a6b5-11eb-8a61-de2738d84cad.png)
When I change the method of isOverrideArgs() return false, agent will use InstMethodsInter and the interceptor is working.
@GuiSong01 I pinged the original author @ascrutae. But you should know, the community usually wouldn't explain codes.
[tornado_test 3.zip](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/files/6375901/tornado_test.3.zip)

> When I change the method of isOverrideArgs() return false, agent will use InstMethodsInter and the interceptor is working.

Sorry, haven't faced this issue.

Let me give you the conclusion first, the feedback chain would work. Think about how MQ and many async mechanisms work today in the distributed system. This is a bad mislead to the users saying, we could only sample the wrong request.

And you are still seeing SkyWalking like it was 4 years ago, now, traces are affecting the topology and metrics analysis. All client sampling is recommended only when it has to be, due to performance impact. Otherwise, don't do client sampling.
Right now, in 2020 and 2021, k8s/micro-service/distributed-service is the trend and reality. Purely using tracing like enhanced logs would not be recommended.
ok,thx

Back to the codes, `#forceSampled` is for making sure the trace continues when context exists and propagated from downstream. And you should know, we never declared `SAMPLE_N_PER_3_SECS` that N is an accurate number and must be kept.

In the end, I think you are walking on the wrong road. If you want to reduce the storage load, try to activate sampling at the backend, but metrics should be accurate and consistent.
If no topology and metrics, actually, you don't need the APM. Trace records are not SkyWalking design goal, APM is.

Are you from the `fast_tracker` company? https://www.mingyuanyun.com/.

You are violating Apache SkyWalking LICENSE. From the codes, you are showing
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/116064829-f9331580-a6b8-11eb-8502-0c7956e6667b.png)

You are re-distributing SkyWalking's python agent. https://github.com/apache/skywalking-python/blob/6ed3043344930334077c0d7da667dba6529db5c8/skywalking/trace/context.py

You should stop the infringement act immediately. Apache License requires you clearly declaring you are distributing Apache SkyWalking!
I am sure Skywalking-Kong agent does not have these two configurations, `namespace` or `max_callback_time_spent`.

I follow this document [README.md](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kong/blob/master/README.md) to install the plugin.

I repackaged the image based on kong:2.4.0. This is my dockerfile:
```Dockerfile
FROM kong:2.4.0

RUN luarocks install kong-plugin-skywalking --local

ENV KONG_NGINX_HTTP_LUA_SHARED_DICT="tracing_buffer 128m"

ENTRYPOINT ["/docker-entrypoint.sh"]

EXPOSE 8000 8001 8443

STOPSIGNAL SIGQUIT

CMD ["kong", "docker-start"]
```

Then I can see the Skywalking-Kong plugins in konga.  Did I install a wrong plugin?

Hi @kasimLZ 
I found two unnecessary items in the configurations you provided. You need to remove `namespace` and `max_callback_time_spent`. 
```
 "config": {
    "service_name": "Kong Service",
    "sample_ratio": 1,
    "service_instance_name": "Kong Service Instance",
    "backend_http_uri": "http://192.168.1.101:12800"
  }
```
Thanks for fixing this.

Issue with application starting with SBT, if play application start with `sbt run` or `sbt testProd`, agent could not send data to backend because of below exception, which is caused by extension class loader.

```java
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Can't find org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.InstanceConstructorInterceptor
```

As explained in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/5242#issuecomment-671032068 extension class loader not support yet,

In order to fix the issue, run play application in production mode (https://www.playframework.com/documentation/2.8.x/Deploying).


1. Run on play project  `sbt dist`. It will create zip file in `target/universal/my-first-app-1.0.zip` folder.
2. unzip zip file
```shell
unzip my-first-app-1.0.zip`
```
3. run `bin/my-first-app` from terminal with `-javaagent` arg.
```shell
bin/my-first-app -J-javaagent:path/to/agent/skywalking-agent.jar=agent.service_name=your_application_name
```
This is a known issue of the script.
@divyakumarjain Welcome to submit a patch to fix this script issue.

> I think #6844 is very clear. Why are you keeping asking?

1、because i think config multiple IPs may only support cluster failover mechanism but not support load balancing. 

2、Also, since OAP backen supports a central registry cluster（like nacos）, can the Agent client get the list of services directly from the registry

thanks

> 1、because i think config multiple IPs may only support cluster failover mechanism but not support load balancing.

I explained to you, why this is not required.

> 2、Also, since OAP backen supports a central registry cluster（like nacos）, can the Agent client get the list of services directly from the registry

Because agent and backend typically are not in one VPC, even region. Things like Nacos is pointless. And with today's k8s DNS driven and service mesh, implementing this client-side service discovery is a really old fashion thing. OAP could work with many register central, agent can't and shouldn't work with all options.

> 3、Also I wonder why the server information of log collection connection needs to be configured separately?Is it to be separate from trace and metric collection?

Because logs could be collected by other agents, fluentd, filebeat, etc. The thing you are seeing today on the release is just a very small piece of SkyWalking's landscape. So it is being defined as a plugin and reporter only.
SkyWalking project is expanding in the last 5 years, many things are upgrading.

@wu-sheng I found that there are several issue related to spring gateway, e.g. #6237 ,so I tried to use the latest version of `spring-cloud-gateway-starter` with `gateway-2.1.x-plugin`, and it will report NPE when forwarding the request, because the enhancement method of `HttpClientFinalizer` class is no longer applicable. I think we should create a new plugin to support the new version of `spring-cloud-gateway`. If no one has done it yet, I can try it.

>  It seems we don't depend on jcenter directly.

Yes for sure, but as I said, the transitive dependencies do, and they have to be downloaded from where they're declared.

First about database metrics, currently, database-related metrics are from your language agent detection. If you can see spans of trace include DB access and SQL in it. You will see the metrics.
`application.yaml`'s MySQL is indicating SkyWalking requires MySQL as storage, nothing about monitoring.

I don't think our OS monitoring has Windows related setup, it should be a Linux kernel. If you want to monitor Windows, you have to learn and write MAL as we provided in default, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/oap-server/server-bootstrap/src/main/resources/otel-oc-rules/vm.yaml

Read the documentation about MAL and take reference to what we gave.

At last, how to use docker and how to make the network connectable for docker env is the capability and skill you should learn. Or if you don't like docker, you could use OpenTelemetry's binary to do so.

I think you should debug the agent in your specific JDK and find out why. You could see on our demo env, the value is positive and normal.
There is always a bug existing, but the environment is yours. So working on that and contribute to the community.

> Is there any way if we can get Class, detailed API calls and Call trace information on this UI.

What do you mean on the UI? Do you mean in the span tags or something?

> Also can we get Profile enabled for all the endpoint to get the maximum information for debugging purpose

That would crash and slow down your application in a disastrous way. A lot of profiling tools out there could do this. APM is designed for product env, so performance impact should be minimal and acceptable.
Only profiling codes when you can't have the idea from traces, logs and metrics.

I think your idea is correct. It is impossible. If they are so closed, we should not build SkyWalking after all. But clearly, APM is a much larger thing than Prometheus told people.

Read this if you want to learn more. Even about metrics, Prometheus can't support many cases when you treat it like an APM rather as a tool.
https://skywalking.apache.org/blog/2020-08-11-observability-at-scale/

I think you need a fluctuation function to check the trend, we don't have that for now. But endpoint level metrics check is a very expensive in-memory cost. But this will still be useful at the service or instance level.
